channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: History Today: When bomb blasts at crowded markets, bus rocked Delhi 20 years ago
FirstUp: Trump travels to South Korea, Amit Shah to address rallies in Bihar... The big news today
In Graphics | Why are rare earths magnets such a big deal?
28-year-old Indian stabs teens on Lufthansa flight to Frankfurt. What happened?
Is the gold rally over? What about silver? Is it a good time to invest?
How lakhs of ChatGPT users exhibit suicidal thoughts week after week
For India-Middle East-Europe Economic Corridor to succeed, Delhi must invest more in Greece and Cyprus
item.description: If IMEEC is truly going to counter the Belt and Road Initiative, it must respond to the maritime advantages China has built over the last decade. Greece and Cyprus do that

item.title: L’affaire Francesca Orsini: Indians apparently still cannot speak without the helping hand of a Western scholar
item.description: There ought not to be a debate over Orsini’s deportation; that there was tells us how structures of knowledge production still perpetuate colonial power relations.

item.title: How Trump-Xi Apec meeting is final chance to prevent a renewed trade war
item.description: The Apec Gyeongju Summit offers a platform for direct, face-to-face dialogue between the two leaders, enabling them to move past lower-level disputes and engage in personal diplomacy

item.title: No longer a geopolitical blind spot: Rising significance of Western Indian Ocean
item.description: The Western Indian Ocean is where security, trade, and diplomacy intersect. India’s sustained engagement, naval exercises, and partnerships with African littoral states demonstrate a forward-looking maritime strategy

item.title: Trump’s top-down Gaza peace plan has all ingredients for disaster
item.description: The proposed Gaza transitional government, to be headed by the former war-mongering British PM Tony Blair, doesn’t represent Palestinians

item.title: Assam, its citizens and their never-ending search for 'citizenship'
item.description: As India revises its electoral rolls, Assam stands apart, still trapped between paperwork and belonging
